ref_source_title: Der Paragraph, Ein Obskures Subjekt des Rechts
scopus_ref_fulltext: Brockhaus-Enzyklopädie, 20 Bde., Wiesbaden <sup>17</sup>1972, hier 14. Bd., 220. Vgl. a. Christian Ahcin u. Claudia Carl, Der Paragraph - Ein obskures Subjekt des Rechts, in: Juristenzeitung Nr. 19, 46. Jg., 1991, 915-917. Wahrscheinlich haben die Griechen das Paragrafenzeichen für die Glossierung des Rechts (paragraphos = das Danebengeschriebene) aus der ägyptischen hieratischen Schrift übernommen, wo die Hieroglyphe »goreh« die Bedeutung von Pause hatte und einem Unterarm vergleichbar war. Im Laufe der Jahrhunderte hat das Zeichen etliche paläografische Abwandlungen erfahren. Im Griechischen hatte es in seinen Einzelteilen Ähnlichkeiten mit dem Gamma, in verschmolzener Form mit dem Pi. So verschmolzen, wurde es im 6. Jahrhundert von Justinian verwendet. - Das Paragrafenzeichen wurde für das neu entstandene Kirchenrecht unverazichtbar. Die Juristenpäpste Alexander III. (1159-81) und Innozenz III. (1189-1216) hatten eine Flut von Dekretalen (das sind alle amtlichen päpstlichen Äußerungen, besonders die Enzykliken) hinterlassen, die alle in das Kirchenrecht aufgenommen werden mussten. Die älteste Sammlung stammt von dem Bologneser Mönch Gratian (Decretum Gratiani), doch der erste amtliche Kirchenrechtskodex wurde endgültig unter Gregor IX. im Jahre 1234 fertiggestellt und den Universitäten Bologna und Paris zugeleitet. Die in ihm kodifizierten Dekretalen hatten unter dem Titel Corpus Iuris Canonici bis 1917 gesetzliche Geltung. 1517 waren sie für Martin Luther Anlass zu seinem Protest. Ohne das auch für weiterführende Hinweise notwendige Paragrafenzeichen wäre eine Kodifizierung des Kirchenrechts kaum denkbar gewesen.

ref_item_title: Voelkerstrafrecht und geltendes deutsches Strafrecht
scopus_ref_fulltext: In contrast to the position in the former German Democratic Republic (see supra note 6), Nuremberg law and principles were not incorporated into the West German legal order. Only the crime of genocide was provided for in section 220a of the Criminal Code pursuant to the obligations of the Genocide Convention. German courts did not refer to the Nuremberg principles when punishing Nazi atrocities. It was only decades later and in relation to the prosecutions of crimes committed under the auspices of the German Democratic Republic that the Federal Supreme Court expressly acknowledged the principles of international criminal law (BGHSt 41, 101, 109). See for details Gerhard Werle, Voelkerstrafrecht und geltendes deutsches Strafrecht, JURISTENZEITUNG 755 (2000);

ref_item_title: Der rechtsschutz gegen europol
scopus_ref_fulltext: Case T-610/97 R, Carlsen v. Council, 1998 ECR II-485, 505; Dyrberg, supra note 184, at 164, 166. In the area of "justice and home affairs," which was marked by endemic secrecy, the Council decided to make public a register of all unclassified documents. EC Justice and Home Affairs Council, Press Release 1998-03-26-6889/98 (Mar. 19, 1998); see Jochen Abr. Frowein & Nico Krisch, Der Rechtsschutz gegen Europol, 19 JURISTENZEITUNG 589 (1998). EU policies on border crossing and movement of people generally have been criticized as reducing standards on the rule of law in part because of the secrecy, restrictions on the competence of the Court of Justice, and the lack of accountability in determining refugee status. H. MEIJERS ET AL., DEMOCRACY, MIGRANTS AND POLICE IN THE EUROPEAN UNION (1997).

Zimmermann, 'Die Asylrechtsreform des Jahres 1993 und das Bundesverfassungsgericht', Juristenzeitung 15/16, 1996, 753; G. Lübbe-Wolf, 'Das Asylgrundrecht nach den Entscheidungen des Bundesverfassungsgerichts vom 14. Mai 1996', DVBl 15/1996, 825; H.-G. Maaßen & M. de Wyl, 'Folgerungen aus den Asylurteilen des Bundesverfassungsgerichts vom 14. Mai 1996 zur Drittstaatenregelung', ZAR 4/1996, 158; R. Marx, Urteile des BVerfG vom 14.Mai 1996 mit Erläuterungen, Neuwied 1996; M. Mohr, 'Die Fortsetzung einer Grundrechtsdemontage', Neue Justiz, 8/1996, 402; C. Tomuschat, 'Asylrecht in der Schieflage', EuGRZ 15-17/1996, 381. A simple description of the consequences is given in K. Hailbronner, 'Das Asylrecht nach den Entscheidungen des Bundesverfassungsgerichts', NvwZ 7/1996, 625. A comprehensive comment in English can be found in R. Marx & K. Lumpp, 'The German Constitutional Court's Decision of 14 May 1996 on the Concept of "Safe Third Countries" - A Basis for Burden Sharing in Europe?', 8 IJRL 419 (1996).

scopus_ref_text: WALTHER RATHENAU, VOM AKTIENWESEN. EINE GESCHÄFTLICHE BETRACHTUNG, 1917, The famous term Unternehmen an sich (enterprise as such) was coined by Haussmann, who used it to describe and criticize Rathenau's theory. See FRITZ HAUSSMANN, VOM AKTIENWESEN UND VOM AK-TIENRECHT 1928, Other scholars of the time viewed it more favorably. Rathenau was an industrialist and a moderate liberal politician, who was serving as German foreign minister when he was assassinated by nationalists in 1922. However, Friedrich Klausing, the editor of the motivational report accompanying the 1937 Aktiengesetz, was most likely a Nazi. He committed suicide after being dismissed as the rector of the University of Prague in 1944, when his son had been identified as one of the conspirators in the assassination attempt on Hitler of July 20. See Bernd Rüthers, Spiegelb
scopus_ref_fulltext: WALTHER RATHENAU, VOM AKTIENWESEN. EINE GESCHÄFTLICHE BETRACHTUNG. (1917). The famous term "Unternehmen an sich" ("enterprise as such") was coined by Haussmann, who used it to describe and criticize Rathenau's theory. See FRITZ HAUSSMANN, VOM AKTIENWESEN UND VOM AK-TIENRECHT (1928). Other scholars of the time viewed it more favorably. Rathenau was an industrialist and a moderate liberal politician, who was serving as German foreign minister when he was assassinated by nationalists in 1922. However, Friedrich Klausing, the editor of the motivational report accompanying the 1937 Aktiengesetz, was most likely a Nazi. He committed suicide after being dismissed as the rector of the University of Prague in 1944, when his son had been identified as one of the conspirators in the assassination attempt on Hitler of July 20. See Bernd Rüthers, Spiegelbild einer Verschwörung: Zwei Abschiedsbriefe zum 20. Juli 1944, 14 JURISTENZEITUNG 689 (2005).

scopus_ref_text: The German Supreme Court (Bundesgerichtshof) has, in the Ausschwitz Concentration Camp Case (in Justiz und NS-Verbrechen, XXI, at 838 et seq, 882, rejected such a broad liability arguing that it would even cover conduct which in no way encourages or supports the commission of specific crimes (also quoted in Tadić Appeals Judgment, supra note 5, § 203 fn. 254, See also the Kvočka Trial Judgment, supra note 19, § 286: The man who merely cleans the office afterhours and, however, sees the child photos and knows that the company is participating in criminal activity and who continues to clean the office, would not be considered a participant in the enterprise because his role is not deemed to be sufficiently significant in the enterprise. For a different, stricter view: F. Bauer, Ideal-oder Real-konkurrenz bei nationalsozialistischen Verbrechen, 1967) 22 Juristenzeitung 625 et seq
scopus_ref_fulltext: The German Supreme Court (Bundesgerichtshof) has, in the "Ausschwitz Concentration Camp Case" (in Justiz und NS-Verbrechen, Vol. XXI, at 838 et seq., 882), rejected such a broad liability arguing that it would even cover conduct which in no way encourages or supports the commission of specific crimes (also quoted in Tadić Appeals Judgment, supra note 5, § 203 fn. 254). See also the Kvočka Trial Judgment, supra note 19, § 286: "The man who merely cleans the office afterhours and, however, sees the child photos and knows that the company is participating in criminal activity and who continues to clean the office, would not be considered a participant in the enterprise because his role is not deemed to be sufficiently significant in the enterprise." For a different, stricter view: F. Bauer, "Ideal-oder Real-konkurrenz bei nationalsozialistischen Verbrechen?", (1967) 22 Juristenzeitung 625 et seq.

scopus_ref_fulltext: BVerfG, JURISTENZEITUNG 716, 718 (1995). Hanno Merkt appears to take a different view. He argues that service of a statement of claim in cases of punitive damages, RICO-claims and treble damages has a negative impact on fundamental rights of a defendant who, according to the”American Rule,” has to bear in any event his attorneys’ fees, even if the claim is fully dismissed (182). Further, he argues that defendant’s U.S. property is impeded. According to Merkt, this constitutes a violation of Art 14 GG (Grundgesetz – Basic Law).

scopus_ref_text: ECR I-1459. Centros Ltd. was incorporated in the U.K., which does not have any minimal capital requirements, in order to avoid Denmark’s high minimal capital requirements (about $27,000), even though Centros did no business in the U.K. Centros’ application to do business in Denmark was denied on the ground that Centros had not established a trade or business in its purported home, the U.K. Centros sued to compel registration, claiming that the Danish law, in compliance with Arts. 52, 56 and 58 of the EC Treaty, provided that a foreign company established in another Member State could do business in Denmark through a branch. The Danish government argued that the EC Treaty did not apply to an internal matter involving a company having no business existence or purpose outside of Denmark, but the Court rejected this argument: “It is contrary to Articles 52 and 58 of the EC Treaty for Member States to refuse to register a branch of a company formed in accordance with the law of another Member State in which it has a registered office but in which it conducts no business where the branch is intended to enable the company to carry on its entire business in which the branch is created (…) thus evading application of the rules governing the formation of companies which, in that state are more restrictive (…).” The Centros Case is quoted and discussed in Coffee, Jr., “European Takeovers: The 13th Directive is Coming”, New York L.J. (November 18,1999). The Court also held, however, that this “interpretation does not prevent the authorities of the Member State concerned from adopting any appropriate measure for preventing or penalising fraud, either in relation to the company itself, or in relation to its members where it has been established that they are in fact attempting by means of the formation of a company to evade their obligations towards private or public creditors (…) of the Member State concerned”. Arguably, this qualifying language would allow Member States to continue to enforce against foreign corporations “social or public policies that are embedded in corporate legislation”. It is not certain, however, that the Centros decision requires EU Member States to substitute an incorporation doctrine similar to that used in the United States and the United Kingdom for the seat doctrine applicable in Germany and most other Member States. See Ebke, “Das Centros-Urteil des EuGH und seine Relevanz für das deutsche internationale Gesellschaftsrecht [The Centros Decision of the European Court of Justice and its Relevance for International Choice of Law for Corporations]”, 54 Juristenzeitung (1999) 656–661. The German Federal Civil Court has submitted the viability of the seat theory to the European Court of Justice for determination (Decision of the Bundesgerichtshof of 3 March, Press release no
scopus_ref_fulltext: C-212/97 Centros, [1999] ECR I-1459. Centros Ltd. was incorporated in the U.K., which does not have any minimal capital requirements, in order to avoid Denmark’s high minimal capital requirements (about $27,000), even though Centros did no business in the U.K. Centros’ application to do business in Denmark was denied on the ground that Centros had not established a trade or business in its purported home, the U.K. Centros sued to compel registration, claiming that the Danish law, in compliance with Arts. 52, 56 and 58 of the EC Treaty, provided that a foreign company established in another Member State could do business in Denmark through a branch. The Danish government argued that the EC Treaty did not apply to an internal matter involving a company having no business existence or purpose outside of Denmark, but the Court rejected this argument: “It is contrary to Articles 52 and 58 of the EC Treaty for Member States to refuse to register a branch of a company formed in accordance with the law of another Member State in which it has a registered office but in which it conducts no business where the branch is intended to enable the company to carry on its entire business in which the branch is created (…) thus evading application of the rules governing the formation of companies which, in that state are more restrictive (…).” The Centros Case is quoted and discussed in Coffee, Jr., “European Takeovers: The 13th Directive is Coming”, New York L.J. (November 18,1999). The Court also held, however, that this “interpretation does not prevent the authorities of the Member State concerned from adopting any appropriate measure for preventing or penalising fraud, either in relation to the company itself, or in relation to its members where it has been established that they are in fact attempting by means of the formation of a company to evade their obligations towards private or public creditors (…) of the Member State concerned”. Arguably, this qualifying language would allow Member States to continue to enforce against foreign corporations “social or public policies that are embedded in corporate legislation”. It is not certain, however, that the Centros decision requires EU Member States to substitute an incorporation doctrine similar to that used in the United States and the United Kingdom for the seat doctrine applicable in Germany and most other Member States. See Ebke, “Das Centros-Urteil des EuGH und seine Relevanz für das deutsche internationale Gesellschaftsrecht [The Centros Decision of the European Court of Justice and its Relevance for International Choice of Law for Corporations]”, 54 Juristenzeitung (1999) 656–661. The German Federal Civil Court has submitted the viability of the seat theory to the European Court of Justice for determination (Decision of the Bundesgerichtshof of 3 March, Press release no. 21/2000).

scopus_ref_fulltext: <sup>154</sup> I am of the opinion that there is at least a categorical difference between the ultra vires review aiming at competences and therefore at the EU Treaties, and the constitutional identity review aiming at substantive law and therefore at the German Constitution, while the fundamental rights review could be conceived of as a subset of the constitutional identity review. scopus_ref_text: 25 Daniel Thym, Annotation to GCC, Judgment of 7.9.2011, in 66 JURISTENZEITUNG 2011–15 (2011). As a student of the “Darker Legacies of Law in Europe,” I cannot refrain from a plea for linguistic sensitivity. It is one thing for Joseph H.H. Weiler to introduce “total law” as a trademark, or for Loïc Azoulai to write about “total harmonisation”; Germans must not disregard the connotations of such terms. The same holds true for the establishment of secondary legal regimes. Germans are as free as anybody else to approve such developments, but they should make it clear that they are aware of the shadow of Ernst Fränkel’s Doppelstaat and Franz Neumann’s Behemoth
scopus_ref_fulltext: <sup>77</sup> Daniel Thym, Euro-Rettungsschirm: zwischenstaatliche Rechtskonstruktion und verfassungsgerichtliche Kontrolle, in 25 EUROPÄISCHE ZEITSCHRIFT FÜR WIRTSCHAFTSRECHT 167–71 (2011); Daniel Thym, Annotation to GCC, Judgment of 7.9.2011, in 66 JURISTENZEITUNG 2011–15 (2011). As a student of the “Darker Legacies of Law in Europe,” I cannot refrain from a plea for linguistic sensitivity. It is one thing for Joseph H.H. Weiler to introduce “total law” as a trademark, or for Loïc Azoulai to write about “total harmonisation”; Germans must not disregard the connotations of such terms. The same holds true for the establishment of secondary legal regimes. Germans are as free as anybody else to approve such developments, but they should make it clear that they are aware of the shadow of Ernst Fränkel’s Doppelstaat and Franz Neumann’s Behemoth.

ref_item_title: Urheberrecht und Tauschplattformen im Internet
scopus_ref_text: If one includes into the combination game the letter A for Administration meaning government offices, then A2A, A2B and A2C result in three further channels of communication via the Internet. The abbreviation P2P (peer-to-peer) has a completely different meaning: here net users are connected directly without an intermediate server. If the exchange of data is also anonymous and encrypted, it is not possible to trace the data being exchanged. Following the court proceedings against Napster, P2P architectures are being used increasingly to exchange sensitive or proprietary data, see on this point
scopus_ref_fulltext: If one includes into the combination game the letter A for Administration meaning government offices, then A2A, A2B and A2C result in three further channels of communication via the Internet. The abbreviation P2P (peer-to-peer) has a completely different meaning: here net users are connected directly without an intermediate server. If the exchange of data is also anonymous and encrypted, it is not possible to trace the data being exchanged. Following the court proceedings against Napster, P2P architectures are being used increasingly to exchange sensitive or proprietary data, see on this point Spindler, “Urheberrecht und Tauschplattformen im Internet”, Juristenzeitung, JZ (2002) 60.

Cf. C. Schmitt, Der Führer schützt das Recht, Deutsche Juristenzeitung, column 945 (1934).

ref_source_title: On the course and intrigue of this infamous congress strongly wanted by Schmitt see Rüthers, Der Führer schützt das Recht note 15, at 135 et seq.
scopus_ref_text: The conclusive speech held by Schmitt is published in Deutsche Juristenzeitung, column 1193 (1936). That Schmitt's anti-Semitism was far from being a transient weakness is proved by his post war writings. In his post war diary one can read entries like the following: “Gerade der assimilierte Jude ist der wahre Feind”; “Denn Juden bleiben immer Juden. Während der Kommunist sich bessern und ändern kann”, cf. E. Freiherr von Medem (Ed.), Glossarium. Aufzeichnungen der Jahre 1947-1951, at 18, 255 (Berlin, 1991). For an appraisal of the Glossarium see R. Mehring, Zu Carl Schmitts Dämonologie, 32 Rechtstheorie 258 (1992). Therefore the affirmations by J.W. Bendersky, Carl Schmitt at Nuremberg, 72 Telos 91, at 95 : “He never succumbed to racism,” and by Schmoeckel, Der Führer schützt das Recht note 15, at 144: “Das Rassendenken hat Schmitt grundsätzlich nicht rezipiert” are totally untenable.
scopus_ref_fulltext: On the course and intrigue of this infamous congress strongly wanted by Schmitt see Rüthers, Der Führer schützt das Recht note 15, at 135 et seq. The conclusive speech held by Schmitt is published in Deutsche Juristenzeitung, column 1193 (1936). That Schmitt's anti-Semitism was far from being a transient weakness is proved by his post war writings. In his post war diary one can read entries like the following: “Gerade der assimilierte Jude ist der wahre Feind”; “Denn Juden bleiben immer Juden. Während der Kommunist sich bessern und ändern kann”, cf. E. Freiherr von Medem (Ed.), Glossarium. Aufzeichnungen der Jahre 1947-1951, at 18, 255 (Berlin, 1991). For an appraisal of the Glossarium see R. Mehring, Zu Carl Schmitts Dämonologie, 32 Rechtstheorie 258 (1992). Therefore the affirmations by J.W. Bendersky, Carl Schmitt at Nuremberg, 72 Telos 91, at 95 (1987): “He never succumbed to racism,” and by Schmoeckel, Der Führer schützt das Recht note 15, at 144: “Das Rassendenken hat Schmitt grundsätzlich nicht rezipiert” are totally untenable.

ref_item_title: Rechtsstaatlichkeitskrise und gegenseitiges Vertrauen im institutionellen Gefüge der EU
scopus_ref_text: 105 the very recent decision of the Court of Appeal in Karlsruhe, judgment of 17 Feb. 2020, 301 AR 156/19. Although rendered in a criminal law context, this decision perfectly illustrates the difficulty of establishing trust even between legally connected jurisdictions. The case related to a Polish extradition request. Since the Court of Justice of the European Union obliges national courts, when reviewing extradition requests under the European Arrest Warrant, to ensure that the European fundamental rights will be respected also in the courts requesting extradition, which includes the principle of the independence of the judiciary, and since the Karlsruhe Court of Appeal had doubts as to whether Polish judges, following recent reforms, were (still) sufficiently independent, the Court refused extradition for the time being. A final decision is outstanding. A Dutch court had similar concerns regarding the independence of the Polish judiciary and has now asked the Court of Justice of the European Union whether the extradition of Polish suspects under the European Arrest Warrant must be halted; the decision of the Rechtbank Amsterdam [District Court of Amsterdam] of 31 July 2020, 13/751021-20 (ECLI:NL:RBAMS:2020:3776). more generally –231 passim
scopus_ref_fulltext: 105 See the very recent decision of the Court of Appeal in Karlsruhe, judgment of 17 Feb. 2020, 301 AR 156/19. Although rendered in a criminal law context, this decision perfectly illustrates the difficulty of establishing trust even between legally connected jurisdictions. The case related to a Polish extradition request. Since the Court of Justice of the European Union obliges national courts, when reviewing extradition requests under the European Arrest Warrant, to ensure that the European fundamental rights will be respected also in the courts requesting extradition, which includes the principle of the independence of the judiciary, and since the Karlsruhe Court of Appeal had doubts as to whether Polish judges, following recent reforms, were (still) sufficiently independent, the Court refused extradition for the time being. A final decision is outstanding. A Dutch court had similar concerns regarding the independence of the Polish judiciary and has now asked the Court of Justice of the European Union whether the extradition of Polish suspects under the European Arrest Warrant must be halted; see the decision of the Rechtbank Amsterdam [District Court of Amsterdam] of 31 July 2020, 13/751021-20 (ECLI:NL:RBAMS:2020:3776). See more generally Andreas Kulick, Rechtsstaatlichkeitskrise und gegenseitiges Vertrauen im institutionellen Gefüge der EU, 75 JuristenZeitung 223–231 passim (2020).

Hörnle points out that the judgment has implications beyond suicide assistance relating to all criminal laws which limit self-determination in end-of-life decision-making, including the prohibition of killing someone on request. Tatjana Hörnle, ‘Der niederländische Hoge Raad und das BVerfG zu Fragen der Sterbehilfe: Die Abgrenzung von Selbstbestimmung und Fremdbestimmung im Einzelfall und als Leitlinie fuer die Rechtspolitik [The dutch Hoge Raad and the German Federal Constitutional Court on Questions Concerning Assisted Dying: Differentiating Between Self-Determination and Outside Influence in Individual Cases and as Guidance for Legal Politics] (2020) 18 Juristenzeitung 872, 873. also discussion in Anette Grünewald, ‘Selbstbestimmtes Sterben [Self-Determined Dying] (2021) (3)
scopus_ref_fulltext: Wiesing, eg, asks why the judgment as it relates to suicide assistance should not be applicable to killing on demand and thus practitioner administration. See Urban Wiesing, ‘The Judgment of the German Federal Consitutional Court Regarding Assisted Suicide: A Template for Pluralistic States’ (2021) J Med Ethics 1, 4. Hörnle points out that the judgment has implications beyond suicide assistance relating to all criminal laws which limit self-determination in end-of-life decision-making, including the prohibition of killing someone on request. See: Tatjana Hörnle, ‘Der niederländische Hoge Raad und das BVerfG zu Fragen der Sterbehilfe: Die Abgrenzung von Selbstbestimmung und Fremdbestimmung im Einzelfall und als Leitlinie fuer die Rechtspolitik’ [The dutch Hoge Raad and the German Federal Constitutional Court on Questions Concerning Assisted Dying: Differentiating Between Self-Determination and Outside Influence in Individual Cases and as Guidance for Legal Politics] (2020) 18 Juristenzeitung 872, 873. ref_item_title: Geltung des Systems und Geltung im System. Wozu man die Grundnorm benötigt - und wozu nicht
scopus_ref_text: With the following words, Jestaedt describes these two kinds of valid norms: “If all norms in a relation of creation meaning: a normative system of validation, a legal order are derived from the first norm, then this grounds this unity of the legal order. Whilst the basic norm conveys the 'validity of the first norm, it also conveys the 'validity for the legal order as a whole contrast to that, regarding the legal positive relations of validity it concerns the belonging to the legal order, therefore not the validity of the legal order, but the validity in the legal order, not the validity of the system or [the] valid system, but the validity in the system or also the systemic validity
scopus_ref_fulltext: With the following words, Jestaedt describes these two kinds of valid norms: “If all norms in a relation of creation - meaning: a normative system of validation, a legal order - are derived from the first norm, then this grounds this unity of the legal order. Whilst the basic norm conveys the 'validity' of the first norm, it also conveys the 'validity' for the legal order as a whole. In contrast to that, regarding the legal positive relations of validity it concerns the belonging to the legal order, therefore not the validity of the legal order, but the validity in the legal order, not the validity of the system or [the] valid system, but the validity in the system or also the systemic validity.” Matthias Jestaedt, Geltung des Systems und Geltung im System. Wozu man die Grundnorm benötigt - und wozu nicht, Juristenzeitung 68 (2013), 1018.

ref_item_title: Maximum versus Minimum Harmonization: Choosing between Unity and Diversity in the Search for the Soul of the Internal Market
ref_source_title: From Single Market to Economic Union: Essays in Memory of John A
scopus_ref_text: lastly, on the plea for a new ruling of consumer rights, in the form of a EU-Regulation on unfair terms: 14) JuristenZeitung 640, 643 et seq. Such a new form of the regulation on unfair contract terms would assuredly contribute to the realisation of the Binnenmarkt (648) and implement the clarity of the terms used by the European legislator (641 et seq). Moving from a minimum harmonisation to a maximum harmonisation model would imply, however, a ‘significant dismantling of established rules Under a maximum model, unlike a minimum model, Member States cannot simply implement the EU rules alongside domestic rules and allow the system(s) to evolve: they must scrutinize the existing pattern of national law which falls within the material scope of the EU measure and ruthlessly exterminate any provisions that are stricter.’ (S. Weatherill N. Nic Shuibhne and L.W. Gormley (eds, Usher (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 187). Namely, the cost of change of form, from the Klauselrichtlinie to the Klauselverordnung, will entail some ‘costs’ that the Member State shall tackle, since the problem of the complex different layers which determine the relationship between national private law, harmonized national private law, national consumer law and EU consumer law (and further) will not be solved by changing the form: H.-W. Micklitz, ‘The Full Harmonization Dream’, (2022) 11(4) Journal of European Consumer and Market Law 117, 120 et seq

Namely, the cost of change of form, from the Klauselrichtlinie to the Klauselverordnung, will entail some ‘costs’ that the Member State shall tackle, since the problem of the complex different layers which determine the relationship between national private law, harmonized national private law, national consumer law and EU consumer law (and further) will not be solved by changing the form: see, H.-W. scopus_ref_fulltext: 16 The figure is therefore not conclusive in terms of the total number of legal disputes in which a violation of the P2B Regulation has been invoked by a party. In a recently published study, the author estimated that in Germany more than 99 out of 100 decisions made by the courts not based on a mutual agreement between the parties are not published. Hanjo Hamann, Der blinde Fleck der deutschen Rechtswissenschaft — Zur digitalen Verfügbarkeit instanzgerichtlicher Rechtsprechung 76 JuristenZeitung 656, 658 (2021). However, it is not possible to deduce from this a plausible number of unreported cases that concern the P2B Regulation. This is because there is a lack of empirically verified findings on which factors, at the level of the lower courts, determine which cases are selected for publication. One can assume that cases in which the P2B Regulation was invoked were considered to be particularly worthy of publication and were therefore - measured against the generally very low publication rate - published comparatively often.

However, sometimes special efforts have to be made to overcome historiographic reluctance, see M. Stolleis, Reluctance to glance in the mirror: The Chang-ing Face of German Jurisprudence after 1933 and post-1945, in DARKER LEGACIES OF LAW IN EUROPE. THE SHADOW OF NATIONAL SOCIALISM AND FASCISM OVER EUROPE AND ITS LEGAL TRADITIONS 1 (C. Joerges & N. S. Ghaleigh eds., 2003). An example for a closer look on one of the most ambiguos legal-academic biographies, picked from the ever-growing piles of literature on Carl Schmitt, is B. Rüthers, Die Tage-bücher Carl Schmitts - ein frühes Selbstporträt?, JURISTENZEITUNG 445, 448 (2004).

ref_item_title: Prolegomena zu einer Theorie des Medizinrechts
scopus_ref_text: Unter Biomedizinrecht kann man die Gesamtheit aller Rechtsnormen und Rechtsgrundsätze verstehen, die den neueren lebenswissenschaftlichen Fortschritt der Medizin betreffen und bzw. oder besondere Grenzbereiche der Medizin, insbesondere zu Beginn und am Ende des Lebens, zum Gegenstand haben. Dem wären das Fortpflanzungsmedizinrecht einschl. des Stammzellrechts, das Gendiagnostikrecht (einschl. genome editing), das Recht der Sterbehilfe einschließlich des Rechts der Patientenverfügung, das Intensivmedizinrecht, zumal das Organtransplantationsrecht sowie die rechtlichen Grundlagen der Humanforschung zuzuordnen; vgl. dazu
scopus_ref_fulltext: <sup>10</sup> Unter Biomedizinrecht kann man die Gesamtheit aller Rechtsnormen und Rechtsgrundsätze verstehen, die den neueren lebenswissenschaftlichen Fortschritt der Medizin betreffen und bzw. oder besondere Grenzbereiche der Medizin, insbesondere zu Beginn und am Ende des Lebens, zum Gegenstand haben. Dem wären das Fortpflanzungsmedizinrecht einschl. des Stammzellrechts, das Gendiagnostikrecht (einschl. genome editing), das Recht der Sterbehilfe einschließlich des Rechts der Patientenverfügung, das Intensivmedizinrecht, zumal das Organtransplantationsrecht sowie die rechtlichen Grundlagen der Humanforschung zuzuordnen; vgl. dazu J. F. Lindner, Prolegomena zu einer Theorie des Medizinrechts, in: Juristenzeitung 74 (2019), 639–648/645.

ref_item_title: Die Fahrlässigkeit als Erkennbarkeit der Tatbestandsverwirklichung
scopus_ref_text: 778 ('... der gleiche Erfolg auch bei einem sorgfaltsgemässen Verhalten eingetreten wäre'); see also H Lange, Adäquanztheorie, Rechtswidrigkeitszusammenhang, Schutzzwecklehre und selbständige Zurechnungsmomente, 31 JuristenZeitung (1976), 198 at 201. Protection purpose (Schutzzweck) and norm purpose (Normzweck) are generally synonymous. Lange, 202; the difference is that with compensation for harm arising out of permitted activities (erlaubte Handlungen), the focus would be on whether the compensation duty operates for the purpose of avoiding the harm in question, not on relation of that harm to the lawfulness of the conduct that triggers the duty of compensation
scopus_ref_fulltext: F-C Schroeder, Die Fahrlässigkeit als Erkennbarkeit der Tatbestandsverwirklichung, 44 JuristenZeitung (1989), 776 at 778 ('... der gleiche Erfolg auch bei einem sorgfaltsgemässen Verhalten eingetreten wäre'); see also H Lange, Adäquanztheorie, Rechtswidrigkeitszusammenhang, Schutzzwecklehre und selbständige Zurechnungsmomente, 31 JuristenZeitung (1976), 198 at 201. Protection purpose (Schutzzweck) and norm purpose (Normzweck) are generally synonymous. Lange, 202; the difference is that with compensation for harm arising out of permitted activities (erlaubte Handlungen), the focus would be on whether the compensation duty operates for the purpose of avoiding the harm in question, not on relation of that harm to the lawfulness of the conduct that triggers the duty of compensation.

ref_item_title: Grenzen des Rückgriffs auf dispositives Gesetzesrecht zur Ersetzung unwirksamer Klauseln in Verbraucherverträgen
ref_source_title: Rinvio pregiudiziale ed interpretazione adeguatrice (la narrazione del civilista)
scopus_ref_text: A similar approach was adopted by the German legislator under § 307 BGB. The provision set out the consequence of ineffectiveness (Unwirksamkeit) for the ‘unreasonable disadvantage’ (unangemessene Benachteiligung) deriving from the violation of the principle of good faith (para 1). The same result applies in case of drafting of the term in unclear and unintelligible language (para 2). The result of the nontransparent drafting of the term will result in the inefficacy of the term (Unwirksamkeit). On the German debate on the compliance of § 307 BGB with the CJEU’s prescriptions on judicial revision, 74(15–16), JuristenZeitung 751 and, in Italian, S. Pagliantini, Milanofiori Assago: Wolters Kluwer, 2023
scopus_ref_fulltext: A similar approach was adopted by the German legislator under § 307 BGB. The provision set out the consequence of ineffectiveness (Unwirksamkeit) for the ‘unreasonable disadvantage’ (unangemessene Benachteiligung) deriving from the violation of the principle of good faith (para 1). The same result applies in case of drafting of the term in unclear and unintelligible language (para 2). The result of the nontransparent drafting of the term will result in the inefficacy of the term (Unwirksamkeit). On the German debate on the compliance of § 307 BGB with the CJEU’s prescriptions on judicial revision, see B. Gsell, ‘Grenzen des Rückgriffs auf dispositives Gesetzesrecht zur Ersetzung unwirksamer Klauseln in Verbraucherverträgen’ (2019) 74(15–16), JuristenZeitung 751 and, in Italian, S. Pagliantini, Rinvio pregiudiziale ed interpretazione adeguatrice (la narrazione del civilista) (Milanofiori Assago: Wolters Kluwer, 2023) 152.
